Been playing this for years and I still love it. Sure, the game gets buggy, but I've never been a crybaby about it. I do not support NFT's which is one big thing I'd like to point out, but otherwise, the game itself is fun. I will keep clapping people's cheeks with Spirit.

game want money. give money. game no work. beautiful.

Don't get me wrong, I love this game... When I can play it.

The problem is a lot of the time it will randomly disconnect you, or decide that you can in fact, not connect to the host. At which point you have to close and reopen the game, at least. But it will keep bugging out if you don't validate the files.

For smoothest game play, you want to validate you files before you even attempt playing for the day.
When there is an update to the game, you can expect a couple of days of rough going, and that's being nice.
The most recent update as of posting this review, you have to close and reopen the game every five or six rounds, because it's so buggy.

People like a well put together game, and this just ain't it.
If you want a game that will frustrate you to tears, but keep you coming back through some unknown level of addiction, this is the game for you.
If you want something well put together, with bug fixes that don't create more bugs, play something else.

I have 200+ hours after only a month. I intend to keep playing just as much. But no, I would not recommend it to other players.
played it for a couple of hours, good game ig they just gotta nerf trickstar

This is the sort of game where the developing studio completely ruins their game as time goes on. Each game is either a killer camping a single hook until everyone is gone or else they just target the same victim while leaving everyone else alone; in both situations, it's rage inducing for everyone involved and a complete annoyance. The devs never listen to the community at all and make daft changes often (there are countless controversies in the communities and a million complaint threads out there over time, too many to name). Huge bugs are common and take ages to fix, to the point where "new" content will be disabled right after release and only be available a month or more afterwards (looking at you, Resident Evil chapter). All of this is common and a pain. The devs are killing their own game over time. It often seems like one big deteriorating mess, compared to what it was many years ago.
